result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam A Neibauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court does not object to probation being transferred to Waukesha County.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Be supervised by the mental health unit. Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete Anger Management counseling. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 8/19/2014:  amended to state that counts one adn two are consecutive to each other and 13CM003578.
Amending Judgments of Conviction (Amended) signed and filed.  Copies sent to parties.  rmm
Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies sent to parties.  rmm
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Rebecca Dallet, Br. 40, for review. mag
HOC request for sentence clarification in 14CF000469 and 13CM003578.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
Effective date:   06-25-2014    Initials:  AAC
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.  rmm

Defendant Adam A Neibauer in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Adam A Neibauer in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.
*
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Court does not object to probation being transferred to Waukesha County.
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 40 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 6/27/14.
- Be supervised by the mental health unit.  Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Adam A Neibauer not in court, in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam A Neibauer in court with attorney Leah R Thomas.  Defendant Adam A Neibauer in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rebecca G.

Defendant Adam A Neibauer in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Adam A Neibauer in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
